Title: The problem with the knowledge argument
Description: What does the knowledge argument actually demonstrate? The argument, which shows up in various forms in numerous philosophical papers and thought experiments, is that we can have a complete physica‚Ä¶

Title: The Watermelon Operator
Description:
In these two most excellent articles,
https://without.boats/blog/let-futures-be-futures
and
https://without.boats/blog/futures-unordered, 
withoutboats introduces the concepts of multi-task and intra-task concurrency.
I want to revisit this distinction --- while I agree that there are different classes
of patterns of concurrency here, I am not quite satisfied with this specific partitioning of the
design space. I will use Rust-like syntax for most of the examples, but I am more interested in the
language-agnostic patterns, rather than in Rust's specific implementation of async.

Title: What I tell people new to on-call
Description:
The first time I went on call as a software engineer, it was exciting‚Äîand ultimately traumatic.
Since then, I've had on-call experiences at multiple other jobs and have grown to really appreciate it as part of the role.
As I've progressed through my career, I've gotten to help establish on-call processes and run some related trainings.

Title: Late Cenozoic
Google Cache Is Now Fully Dead
Description: Google has now totally disabled the Google Cache from completely working.  Earlier this year, Google removed the cache link from the search result snippets.  Then a couple of weeks ago, added links to the Wayback Machine.  Now, the direct link to see the Google Cache has been fully disabled.

Title: Time spent programming is often time well spent - Stan Bright
Description: Was the time I spent writing my RSS scripts more than the time I would now spend thinking about the ‚Äúbest‚Äù RSS aggregator and reader? Doesn‚Äôt matter. I enjoyed writing the scripts. I learned new things and got satisfaction out of seeing them run correctly. I get nothing like that out of comparing apps and services.
